alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 3:07PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Oahu in Honolulu County. * WHEN...Until 615 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain focused over east Oahu between Kahaluu and Waikiki. Heavy rainfall will continue to move over portions of Oahu from the northeast over the next several hours. Rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour can be expected from this rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Honolulu, Pearl City, Waiahole, Aiea, Waikane, Halawa, Kahaluu, Mililani, Ahuimanu, Waikele, Salt Lake, Moanalua, Wahiawa, Waipahu, Wheeler Field, Kaaawa, Kalihi, and Punaluu. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 615 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
